basics.name: Владислав Камердинеров
basics.label: DevOps / SRE
basics.summary: DevOps/SRE with three years of experience in application support and operations. A regular participant in pieces of training and courses for self-development. I'm glad find mates with passionate about their work, and add my knowledge to they a common cause.

work.name: EPAM
work.summary: EPAM Systems Inc (EPAM Systems) is a technology company that offers software engineering services for software development and digital platforms.
highlights: Created and implemented service for collect information from dozens of environments about the versions of a particular service and its status
Designing Serverless AWS architecture for application biotech/cheminformatics from MVP to production release
Led a small DevOps/System Engineer team using Kanban to support several RnD projects in crop protection domain
Implemented and configured logging, monitoring, and alerting on several k8s clusters using Grafana and Loki
Provisioning various AWS infrastructure services using IaC methods, working with customer support team
Supported several projects and their environments single-handedly

work.name: Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey (MIBS)
work.summary: Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey (MIBS) was founded in 2003. The main line of company’s work is provision of high-tech diagnostic and therapeutic care.
highlights: Maintenance and repair Siemens Magnetom Symphony 1.5T magnetic resonance imager with auxiliary equipment;
Administration Windows Server 2012 (DICOM/SQL servers) & Linux (deb based distro)

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
